snippet: Populations of aquatic life collapsed because of overfishing of sardines and other small fish that are used to feed larger ones, according to a report.
abstract: International group of marine scientists is calling for cuts in commercial fishing for sardines and other small fish whose use as food for fish farms is soaring; scientists say the catch should be cut in half for some fisheries to protect populations of both the fish and the natural predators that depend on them.
lead_paragraph: Populations of aquatic life collapsed because of overfishing of sardines and other small fish that are used to feed larger ones, according to a report.

headline.seo: Forage Fish Catches Should be Reduced, Report Says
headline.main: Too Many Small Fish Are Caught, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Too Many Small Fish Are Caught, Report Says
